intro: Murdannia crocea subsp. ochracea, commonly known as the yellow murdannia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Commelinaceae. It is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and lanceolate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with bright yellow petals, which are typically borne on short pedicels. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in wet or disturbed soils. The subspecies ochracea is distinguished by its pale yellow flowers and slightly different leaf morphology compared to other subspecies of Murdannia crocea.
